definitions.definition: Able and efficient ; having the ability needed for a specific task ; having the disposition to do something; permitting or being susceptible to something.
examples: He does not need help; he is capable of eating on his own.
As everyone knew, he was capable of violence when roused.
That fact is not capable of proof.

definitions.definition: Of sufficient capacity or size for holding , containing , receiving or taking in ; accessible to. Construed with of , for or an infinitive.

main_definition: Able and efficient ; having the ability needed for a specific task ; having the disposition to do something; permitting or being susceptible to something.
